name: Jpcepgrammar
tagline: Web page and javascript library to learn PCEP grammar. Based on HTML and javascript.
body:
### PCEP Tutorial and Grammar
PCEP stands for Path Computation Element Protocol. Since it initial specification in RFC 5440, a lot of new RFCs and drafts have been published. This web page, powered by a javascript library, aims at compiling the grammar of all PCEP RFCs and drafts. The document [draft-cmfg-pce-pcep-grammar-02](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cmfg-pce-pcep-grammar-02) expresses the concern with current issues with existing RBNF notation for PCEP messages and extensions.

### Author
Oscar Gonzalez de Dios (@oscargdd)

### Acknowledgement
This work was supported in part by the [PACE Support Action project](www.ict-pace.net) under grant agreement number 619712.

The idea of having a web page with all the messages and objects from PCEP came from discussions in IETF and in the PACE Project between Adrian Farrel, Ram√≥n Casellas and Oscar Gonzalez. The discussions in IETF regarding existing RBNF notation for PCEP messages and extensions also included Cyril Margaria, Dhruv Dody and Xian Zhang.
